text:
Currently, the junitreport allows two values for the style attribute: frames 
and noframes.
The generated file allways gets extension .html.

It would be useful if you could define another stylesheet.
It would also be useful if you could pass the filename for the generated file.

This would, for example, allow you to create XSL-FO files with an xml 
extension from the task.

Regards, Jan
creator: j_cumps@yahoo.com
jan@materne.de
text:
<junitreport>
    <report format="noframes" styledir="${junitreport.xsl.fo}"/>
</junitreport>

and your
  ${junitreport.xsl.fo}/junit-noframes.xsl
present should do the job.


Having the filename as parameter is a duplicate of
http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=21042
